ISSUE.TITLE: Drone CLI don't exit container
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: This was a question that came up on gitter that I wanted to open an issue for. cc @maxim > is there a way for me to start an image by hand and get a checkout in it, so i can debug some stuff? If i just enter a docker image I don't get the repo checkout. > so something like > 1. launch image with /bin/bash entry point (i can do this) > 2. run drone pre-script stuff in it <- need a way to do this > 3. play around in the container Today we can use the `drone build` command to run a build locally, however, it exits as soon as the build completes. It would be nice if there were an option to drop you in a bash prompt inside the container after the build is complete for further troubleshooting. I believe this is something we can achieve with the `bash --init-file` option. We would run the build script as an init file, dropping you to the prompt once complete. For more details: http://serverfault.com/questions/368054/run-an-interactive-bash-subshell-with-initial-commands-without-returning-to-the Note that issue #749 is a definite pre-requesite to this request
